pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:0.5: 3. The third training rule on the robe season
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.1.1: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.1.2: a monk had been given robe-cloth outside the robe season.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.1.3: While he was making the robe, he realized there was not enough cloth.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.1.4: Lifting it up, he smoothed it out again and again.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.1.5: While walking about the dwellings, the Buddha saw that monk acting in this way.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.1.6: He went up to him and said,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.1.8: “Sir, I’ve been given this out-of-season robe-cloth,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.1.9: but it’s not enough to make a robe.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.1.10: That’s why I lift it up and smooth it out again and again.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.1.11: “Are you expecting to receive more cloth?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.1.13: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.1.14: “Monks, I allow you to keep out-of-season robe-cloth if you are expecting to receive more.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.2.1: When they heard about this, some monks kept out-of-season robe-cloth for more than a month,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.2.2: keeping them in bundles on a bamboo robe rack.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.2.3: While walking about the dwellings, Venerable Ānanda saw that robe-cloth,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.3.1: “It’s our out-of-season robe-cloth, which we’re keeping because we’re expecting more.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.3.2: “But how long have you kept it?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.3.4: Venerable Ānanda complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.3.5: “How can these monks keep out-of-season robe-cloth for more than a month?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.3.6: After rebuking those monks in many ways, Venerable Ānanda told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.3.7: “Is it true, monks, that there are monks who do this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.3.10: “How can those foolish men keep out-of-season robe-cloth for more than a month?
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.3.12: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.3.13.1: ‘When his robe is finished and the robe season has ended, if out-of-season robe-cloth is given to a monk, he may receive it if he wishes.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.3.14: If he receives it, he should quickly make a robe.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.3.15: If there is not enough cloth, but he is expecting more, he should keep it at most one month to make up the lack.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.3.16: If he keeps it longer than that, then even if he expects more cloth, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.1.2: the monk has made a robe; or the robe-cloth has been lost, destroyed, or burnt; or his expectation of receiving further robe-cloth is disappointed.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.1.4: it has ended according to one of the eight key terms or the Sangha has ended it.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.1.6: for one who has not participated in the robe-making ceremony, it is robe-cloth given during the eleven months.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.1.7: for one who has participated in the robe-making ceremony, it is robe-cloth given during the seven months.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.1.8: Also, if it is given in the robe season, but the cloth is designated, it is called “out-of-season robe-cloth”.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.1.10: If it is given by a sangha, by a group, by a relative, or by a friend, or if it is rags, or if he got it by means of his own property.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.1.12: if he desires, he may receive it.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.1.13: If he receives it, he should quickly make a robe:
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.1.14: it should be made within ten days.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.1.15: If there is not enough cloth:
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.1.16: if there is not enough cloth when the robe is being made.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.1.17: He should keep it at most one month:
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.1.18: he should keep it one month at a maximum.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.1.20: for the purpose of making up the lack.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.1.22: he is expecting more from a sangha, from a group, from a relative, or from a friend, or he is expecting to get rags, or he is expecting to get it by means of his own property.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.2.1: If he keeps it longer than that, then even if he expects more cloth:
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.2.2: If he is given the expected robe-cloth on the same day as he was given the original robe-cloth, it must be made into a robe within ten days.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.2.3: If he is given the expected robe-cloth the day after he was given the original robe-cloth, it must be made into a robe within ten days.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.2.4: If he is given the expected robe-cloth two days after …
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.2.21: … nineteen days after he was given the original robe-cloth, it must be made into a robe within ten days.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.2.22: If he is given the expected robe-cloth twenty days after he was given the original robe-cloth, it must be made into a robe within nine days.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.2.23: If he is given the expected robe-cloth twenty-one days after he was given the original robe-cloth, it must be made into a robe within eight days. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.2.30: If he is given the expected robe-cloth twenty-eight days after he was given the original robe-cloth, it must be made into a robe within one day.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.2.31: If he is given the expected robe-cloth twenty-nine days after he was given the original robe-cloth, it must be determined, assigned to another, or given away on that very day.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.2.32: If he does not determine it, assign it to another, or give it away, it becomes subject to relinquishment at dawn on the thirtieth day.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.2.33: The robe-cloth should be relinquished to a sangha, a group, or an individual.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.2.34: “And, monks, it should be relinquished like this.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.2.35: (To be expanded as in Relinquishment 1, with appropriate substitutions.)
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.2.36: ‘Venerables, this out-of-season robe-cloth, which I have kept for more than a month, is to be relinquished.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.2.37: I relinquish it to the Sangha.’ …
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.2.40: ‘I give this robe-cloth back to you.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.2.41: If he is given the expected robe-cloth, but it is different from the robe-cloth originally given to him, and there are days remaining, he does not have to make a robe if he does not want to.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.3.1: If it is more than a month and he perceives it as more, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.3.2: If it is more than a month, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.3.3: If it is more than a month, but he perceives it as less, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.3.4: If it has not been determined, but he perceives that it has, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.3.5: If it has not been assigned to another, but he perceives that it has, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.3.6: If it has not been given away, but he perceives that it has, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.3.7: If it has not been lost, but he perceives that it has, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.3.8: If it has not been destroyed, but he perceives that it has, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.3.9: If it has not been burnt, but he perceives that it has, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.3.10: If it has not been stolen, but he perceives that it has, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.3.11: If he uses robe-cloth that should be relinquished without first relinquishing it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.3.12: If it is less than a month, but he perceives it as more, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.3.13: If it is less than a month, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.3.14: If it is less than a month and he perceives it as less, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.4.2: if within a month it has been determined, assigned to another, given away, lost, destroyed, burnt, stolen, or taken on trust;
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.4.4: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.4.5: The third training rule on the robe season, the third, is finished.
